metadata.title: CVE-2019-16781 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In WordPress before 5.3.1, authenticated users with lower privileges (likecontributors) can inject JavaScript code in the block editor, which isexecuted within the dashboard. It can lead to an admin opening the affectedpost in the editor leading to XSS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16781` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 5.3.2+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.2+dfsg1-1').
